column2: Description (please cover major functions of the tool)
column4: How to access the tool (e.g. URL, DOI if published)
column5: If there is a metadata (landing) page for the tool, please provide the URL:

column2: Helpful for seeing how Google sees the data and troubleshooting issues (e.g. missing properties). Add a URL of webpage with schema, or paste code, to validate the Schema.org.

CodeMeta is a vocabulary for describing research software. Most of its vocabulary are from Schema.org/softwarecomponent.
Codemeta generator is a web application to generate CodeMeta document (i.e. codemeta.json)

Gleaner is a program and a set of supporting Docker containers that allow for the harvesting, validation and indexing of JSON-LD data graphs published in web pages. Its goal is to allow users to generate graphs and other searchable indexes based on the exposed JSON-LD.
column9: Open source developed under the NSF EarthCube

column2: Provides an editor for http://schema.org entries for EarthCube registered datasets
column7: Geoscience Cyberinfrastructure for Open Discovery in the Earth Sciences (GeoCODES)/Instrumental Software Technologies, Inc. (ISTI)

column2: tool for creating valid schema.org  markups
RDM tool for describing datasets and publishing; supports multiple ontologies, including SDO https://github.com/feup-infolab/dendro-ontologies
column7: Faculdade de Engenharia da Universidade do Porto, Porto Portugal

column2: Will validate the schema.org markup of the current page in Chrome against the science-on-schema.org guidelines
successor to Google Structured Data Testing Tool

metadata management tool that lets the user create a customized template for their metadata, specifying the properties and controlled terms used to describe the filled-out metadata. Schema.org is one of the sources supported for the specification of properties and controlled terms. The resulting metadata is viewable in JSON-LD, RDF, and plain JSON.
column7: Stanford University (Center for Biomedical Informatics Research)
column9:
license is 2-clause BSD (why are BSD licenses not on the list?)
keyword could be generate markups, but it's a little more (like Dendro?) 'generated metadata usable as markups'

column2: General ontology management repository that has schema.org as one of its vocabularies. BioPortal tools include API access to vocabulary branches, annotation of text, and auto-generated mappings from schema.org terms to hundreds of other ontologies.
column7: Stanford University (Center for Biomedical Informatics Research)
column9:
license is 2-clause BSD 
keyword could be 'provide markup vocabularies'.
BioPortal supports any type of vocabulary; you can install your own version using our OntoPortal distributions.
